Column Comment.0: CATALOGUE ADDITIVE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the list of kinds ofadditives. Think of this table as a catalogue of all the kinds of additives that can bepurchased or created. This table can be used to store information about thepackaging and quantity per package.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: CATALOGUE ADDITIVE GROUP: The class or group of additives that this additivebelongs to, such as drill mud additive, treatment additive, processing additive etc.Within each group of additives, many types of additives may be described using CATADDITIVE TYPE. Note that the function of this table may also be assumed by theCLASSIFICATION module for more robust and complete classifications. Note that ifyou use this column in this table, you may be storing data that is redundant to thedata in CAT ADDITIVE TYPE. Please use good data management practices to avoiddata confusion. Usually this column is used only when the specific type of additive isnot known.
Column Comment.3: ADDITIVE NAME: The common name given to this kind of additive.
Column Comment.4: CATALOGUE ADDITIVE TYPE: A material added to a fluid to perform one or morespecific functions, such as a weighting agent, viscosifier or lubricant. (SchlumbergerOilfield Glossary). Note that the function of this table may also be assumed by theCLASSIFICATION module for more robust and complete classifications.
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.7: MANUFACTURER: the unique identifier for the business associate whomanufactures this kind of equipment.
Column Comment.8: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.9: PURCHASE QUANTITY: the quantity of the additive that is purchased for this item.Works in concert with PURCHASE QUANTIFY (how much), PURCHASE QUANTITYUOM (kilograms, pounds), PURCHASE TYPE (sacks, bags, blocks, pails). Forexample an additive may be available in 20 Kg sacks, or 50 Kg bales.
Column Comment.10: PURCHASE QUANTITY TYPE: the type of quantity of the additive that is purchasedfor this item, such as sacks, bails, pails etc. Works in concert with PURCHASEQUANTIFY (how much), PURCHASE QUANTITY UOM (kilograms, pounds),PURCHASE TYPE (sacks, bags, blocks, pails).
Column Comment.11: PURCHASE QUANTITY UNIT OF MEASURE: Works in concert with PURCHASEQUANTIFY (how much), PURCHASE QUANTITY UOM (kilograms, pounds),PURCHASE TYPE (sacks, bags, blocks, pails).
Column Comment.12: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.13: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.14: SUPPLIER: the name of the company from whom this substance can be obtained
Column Comment.15: UNIVERSAL PRODUCT CODE: The UPC code for this additive.
Column Comment.16: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.18: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.20: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
